english: value; worth; to be worth; to deserve

etymology.description: Semantic: 亻(亻) (rén, "person") + Phonetic: 直(直) (zhí, "straight") = a person's worth or value
etymology.interpretation: The character 值(值) (zhí, "value; worth") illustrates the concept of a person 亻(亻) (rén, "person") whose directness or straightforwardness 直(直) (zhí, "straight") is valued, thus converging on the idea of 'worth' or 'value'.

examples.chinese: 这幅字画值两千元(這幅字畫值兩千元)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè fú zìhuà zhí liǎngqiān yuán.
examples.english: This piece of calligraphy is worth two thousand yuan.

examples.chinese: 他努力工作(他努力工作)，这一切真的很值(這一切真的很值)。
examples.pinyin: Tā nǔlì gōngzuò, zhè yīqiè zhēn de hěn zhí.
examples.english: He works hard, and all of it is truly worthwhile.
